quote: Ah, the Leaky Cauldron! You get the pea soup, make sure you eat it before it eats you!
by: Shrunken Head in Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban

quote: Soup is the sound of the hearth and the home
Soup is a lot like a family. Each ingredient enhances the others; each batch has its own characteristics, and it needs time to simmer to reach full flavor.
A little science. A little magic. And a little chicken soup.
Soup puts the heart at ease, calms down the violence of hunger, eliminates the tension of the day, and awakens and refines the appetite.
Eating soup with a fork: slow and messy.
Hungry and thirsty? Soup solves both problems at once.
A little spoon for a cup of soup teaches to be patient; and the big one, to be greedy!
Alphabet soup is my magic eight ball. Served hot or cold, words are delicious
I can teach you to bottle fame, brew glory, even stopper in death.
Double, double toil and trouble; fire burn and cauldron bubble

I don't expect you will really understand the beauty of the softly simmering cauldron with its shimmering fumes, the delicate power of liquids that creep through human veins, bewitching the mind, ensnaring the senses.
Eye of newt, and toe of frog, Wool of bat, and tongue of dog, Adder's fork, and blind-worm's sting, Lizard's leg, and owlet's wing, For a charm of powerful trouble, Like a hell-broth boil and bubble.
... we had once called out hello into the cauldron of the world and then run away before anyone could respond.
